column4: there are grub-floppy and grub-cd images on the net that can be used to repair a grub install
yes, IMO
query :P
use the .run
there should be a .run file available for the nforce drivers
i've never had any problems getting those to run on debian and debian-like systems
no, i mean a .run file you can download from nvidia's site
where do you find those drivers, are they for nf2?
on nvidia's web site, by following the links for drivers
thanks
see, for example, the first link on this page: http://www.nvidia.com/object/linux_nforce_1.0-0301.html
i get an error
the installation cant find any precompiled kernel interface
are you familiar with the error: "No precompiled kernel interface was found to match your kernel"
yes, it means you need the kernel headers to build the modules
and how to do that?

you'll need to download the .debs for the linux-headers packages manually, put them on a CD and carry them to the PC that way, i suspect (since i'm guessing the PC in question isn't online as it has no ethernet drivers without the nforce drivers)
im online with this computer (ubuntu) using another nw card
ok, then easy, just install the linux-headers package via your favourite package manager :)
do i need to reboot or something after installation?
are you there?
